formalpara.title: Figure 5. Mechanisms for targeting dosage compensation complexes to X
formalpara.para: An X may contain one (1), several (II and III) or numerous (IV) cis-acting recognition elements to recruit the complex. After initial binding, the complex may spread (I and II) or not spread (III and IV) along X chromosomes. Model I reflects mammalian X inactivation. Model II was thought to reflect fly dosage compensation, but recent evidence suggests that Model IV may more accurately reflect the fly mechanism. Model II reflects worm dosage compensation.
